summary: Dashboard app that fetches time-series JSON data from a Google Apps Script endpoint and visualizes Temperature (Filtered & CSV) and CO₂ (Right/Left/CSV) over a shared timestamp axis (synced zoom/pan), with a professional card-based layout (light mode default, optional dark mode) using accent color #65714B. Header should show title only (no logo). CO₂ scaling: keep CO2 CSV as (%) and scale CO2 Rechts/Links by x0.001 so all three CO₂ series are in (%).
architectural_notes: Data source is a Google Apps Script web app returning a JSON array of objects.
Chart x-axis uses ISO timestamp field "Timestamp"; y-axis uses "Temperature Filtered(F)".
Numeric values may be strings using comma as decimal separator (e.g., "71,86") and must be parsed accordingly.
Chart should use a fixed Y-axis domain of 70°F to 102°F for temperature visualization.
Incoming JSON now uses a different structure; "Timestamp" is provided in a non-ISO string format (e.g., "10/02/26 10:42:57") and must be parsed accordingly.
JSON endpoint includes CO₂ fields "CO2 Rechts", "CO2 Links", and "CO2 CSV(%)" in the same array objects as temperature data.
Dashboard will include two full-width chart cards (Temperature and CO₂) stacked vertically, sharing the same time axis domain.
Chart interactions should support click-drag/scroll zoom with a synchronized time-range state applied to all charts; light mode default with optional dark mode.
Remove all logo functionality/assets from the UI; header displays title only (no logo image, no logo fallback text).
CO₂ units/scaling: keep "CO2 CSV(%)" as-is (no x10000 ppm conversion); multiply "CO2 Rechts" and "CO2 Links" by 0.001 so all three CO₂ series are in (%) on the chart.
known_issues: UI bug: card/plot title bar tint is only applied to part of the header area; should span the full title bar.
Build/deployment can fail with an "internal configuration error" from the Caffeine platform even when retrying builds.

existing_features.title: Create a dashboard page that fetches JSON time-series data from the provided Google Apps Script web app endpoint (https://script.google.com/macros/s/AKfycbxnSb-bzTLWQmbHbo-ZBwxZn9444juSqzHjLokPZklrA86hXME_rt3NH8x1d-8xo8ZJoQ/exec) and visualizes "Temperature Filtered(F)" as a function of "Timestamp".

Normalize and parse the incoming data fields so that "Temperature Filtered(F)" values represented as strings with comma decimals (e.g., "71,86") are converted into numeric values suitable for plotting.
Refresh the plotted series automatically on an interval aligned with the dataset cadence (every 10 seconds), without requiring a page reload.
Add basic UI states and controls: show last updated time, loading state, error state with retry, and a manual refresh action.

If browser-side fetching of the Google Apps Script endpoint is blocked (e.g., by CORS), provide a backend canister query/update method that fetches the JSON from the same URL and returns it to the frontend, and wire the frontend to use this backend method as its data source.

Apply a cohesive visual theme suitable for a sensor/controls dashboard (e.g., clean industrial look with neutral backgrounds and high-contrast accents), and use it consistently across layout, typography, and chart styling. Do not use a blue/purple primary palette.
Fix the temperature chart Y-axis scale so it is always locked to a 70°F–102°F range (i.e., the Y-axis domain must be exactly [70, 102] regardless of incoming data values).
Render the temperature series line in red and ensure the active dot uses the same red color.
Add a chart legend that clearly labels the plotted series as temperature in °F.
Update the site branding to look more professional and set the website title to "Conceptmachine Live Data" (including the browser tab title and the main header title shown in the dashboard UI).

Update the dashboard color theme to match the palette used on https://eagletrax.mypetersime.com/ and apply it consistently across layout surfaces (background/card), typography, buttons, and chart styling (grid/axes/tooltip/series).

Update the frontend data parsing to support the new Google Apps Script JSON array schema where numeric fields (including "Temperature Filtered(F)" and "Temperature CSV(F)") can be numbers (not only strings), and where "Timestamp" uses the non-ISO format "DD/MM/YY HH:mm:ss" (example: "10/02/26 10:42:57"). The parsed series must remain chronologically sorted and must continue to refresh on the existing 10-second interval.

Extend the temperature time-series model and chart to plot an additional series for "Temperature CSV(F)" alongside the existing "Temperature Filtered(F)" series. Render "Temperature CSV(F)" as a red dashed line, and include it as a separate entry in the chart legend with an English label.

Switch the dashboard styling to a clean, white-forward design and use #65714B as the primary accent color. Apply the accent consistently across key UI elements (buttons/links/highlights) and chart styling where a primary accent is used, while keeping the temperature-series styling requirements intact.
Add the provided website logo image as a static asset and display it in the dashboard header next to the "Conceptmachine Live Data" title, aligned cleanly within the existing header layout.

Remove the current header logo asset reference and use the newly provided uploaded image as the dashboard header logo instead. Update the header in TemperatureDashboardPage so it points to the new static asset in frontend/public/assets/generated and keeps a clean alignment with the existing title block.

Add the newly uploaded original JPG file (2026-02-10_10-54-59-1.jpg) as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, and update the dashboard header logo to use this JPG instead of the current /assets/generated/conceptmachine-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png reference.

Keep the header logo sizing and alignment clean and consistent within the existing header layout when switching to the JPG (no overlap with the title/subtitle, and the logo remains visually balanced with the "Conceptmachine Live Data" text block).

Update ONLY the footer content container div at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/footer[1]/div[1]/div[1] (the <div className="text-center text-sm ..."> inside TemperatureDashboardPage) to make the #65714B accent color more prominent, while keeping all user-facing text in English and keeping the existing footer message and caffeine.ai link destination intact.
Update the dashboard footer credit to replace the current “Built with love using caffeine.ai” pill/link with the plain text “Built by Hannes @Petersime” (no caffeine.ai wording shown).
Apply the accent color #65714B to the dashboard title bar (header bar) so the header visually uses the accent color more prominently while keeping readability and the existing layout intact.
Replace the header subtitle text under “Conceptmachine Live Data” from “Real-time temperature monitoring system” to “Updated every 10 min”.
Update the chart legend labeling so it clearly indicates that “Temperature CSV (°F)” is represented by a dashed line.
Redesign the dashboard page layout to look classy and enterprise/professional while keeping a card-based layout and keeping the primary accent color set to #65714B across the UI.
Add a second full-width CO₂ chart card below the temperature chart card on the dashboard page, with both chart cards stacked vertically and each filling the available container width.

Extend the frontend data model and parsing to extract CO₂ fields from the same JSON endpoint records: "CO2 Rechts", "CO2 Links", and "CO2 CSV(%)", and keep the resulting series chronologically sorted by "Timestamp".

Implement the CO₂ chart visualization using the parsed CO₂ fields: plot "CO2 Rechts" and "CO2 Links" as solid dark-green lines and plot "CO2 CSV(%)" as a dark-green dashed line; include a legend that clearly labels all three series in English and indicates the dashed series.

Change the temperature chart series styling from the current red to a darker red shade for both the solid (Temperature Filtered) and dashed (Temperature CSV) series, including matching active-dot color behavior.
Add optional dark mode support with light mode as the default, including a theme toggle control in the dashboard UI that switches the app between light and dark themes without a page reload.

Add interactive time-range zooming/panning for the charts using click-drag and scroll interactions, and ensure the visible time range stays synchronized across both the temperature chart and the CO₂ chart (zoom/pan on one updates the other).
Load the full available dataset by default and allow users to zoom into a specific time window without re-fetching a subset; provide a clear way to return to the full-range view.

Add the newly uploaded JPG file (2026-02-10_10-54-59-2.jpg) as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the dashboard header logo image in frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx to use this JPG (instead of the current /assets/generated/conceptmachine-logo-icon.dim_256x256.png), keeping the existing clean sizing/alignment and preventing overlap with the title/subtitle.

Fix the chart-card title bars (CardHeader) for both the Temperature and CO₂ cards in frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx so the darker tint/background color is applied uniformly across the entire title/header area (full width and full header height), not only to a portion of the header.

Add the newly uploaded JPG file (2026-02-10_10-54-59-3.jpg) as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the dashboard header logo image in frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx to use /assets/generated/2026-02-10_10-54-59-3.jpg (replacing the current /assets/generated/2026-02-10_10-54-59-2.jpg reference), keeping the existing clean sizing/alignment and preventing overlap with the title/subtitle.
Update the header subtitle text in frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx from "Enterprise Data Logging System • Updated every 10 min" to exactly "data logging • Updated every 10-20 min".

Convert the CO₂ CSV series to ppm by multiplying the parsed "CO2 CSV(%)" values by 10000 and update CO₂ chart labeling to match: change legend and tooltip text from "CO2 CSV (%) - dashed" to "CO2 CSV (ppm) - dashed".

Update the header logo in "frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx" to use src "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogo.jpg" and keep the exact same sizing and position/alignment as the current logo (do not change the existing size/position classes).

Add the user-provided static image file "PetersimeLogo.jpg" to the frontend static assets under "frontend/public/assets/generated/" and ensure it is included in the deployed build output so the existing header logo reference (src "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogo.jpg") loads successfully.

Add the uploaded image file "PetersimeLogov2.jpg" to the frontend static assets under "frontend/public/assets/generated/" and ensure it is included in the deployed build output so it can be loaded from the public path "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogov2.jpg".

Update the dashboard header logo in "frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx" to use src "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogov2.jpg" (replacing the current "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogo.jpg") while keeping the exact same sizing and position/alignment classes so the layout does not change.

Eliminate broken/stale logo asset references so the app uses exactly one header logo path: update the dashboard header in "frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx" to reference the single, correct deployed asset path "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogov2.jpg" and remove/replace any other logo paths used by the dashboard header.

Add a visible, English-only fallback when the header logo fails to load: if the image at "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogov2.jpg" errors, show a small inline text indicator in the header (next to where the logo would be) stating that the logo failed to load, without breaking the header layout.

Remove unused/generated logo image files from "frontend/public/assets/generated" that are not referenced anywhere in the current app, keeping only what is required for the deployed header logo, to prevent future confusion about which asset is active.

Completely redo the dashboard header logo implementation in "frontend/src/pages/TemperatureDashboardPage.tsx" so the header uses ONLY "/assets/generated/PetersimeLogov3.jpg" as the logo image source, with no references to older logo filenames (e.g., PetersimeLogov2.jpg, PetersimeLogo.jpg, or date-stamped logo files).

Remove the current in-header error fallback UI that displays the user-facing text "Logo failed to load" and replace it with a clean reworked logo rendering that does not show any logo-error text in the header UI.

Clean up logo assets so the app does not contain multiple confusing header-logo files: remove unused logo images in "frontend/public/assets/generated" that are not referenced anywhere after switching to PetersimeLogov3.jpg, keeping only what is required for the deployed header logo.
Remove the dashboard header logo entirely so the header displays only the existing title/subtitle text block (no logo image, no logo wrapper spacing), and remove any logo-related UI in the header.

Update CO₂ data parsing so that all three CO₂ series are in percent (%): keep "CO2 CSV(%)" in its original unit (no x10000 conversion) and manually scale "CO2 Rechts" and "CO2 Links" by multiplying each by 0.001.
Update the CO₂ chart labels/legend/tooltip and axis labeling to reflect percentages (%), including changing the CO₂ CSV series label to "CO2 CSV (%) - dashed" (and removing any "ppm" wording).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build an app that reads JSON from the provided Google Apps Script URL and plots "Temperature Filtered(F)" over time using "Timestamp" (data points every ~10 seconds).
Fix the chart Y-axis range to 70°F–102°F for the temperature plot.
Style the temperature series line in red.
Add a chart legend.
Update the site title to "Conceptmachine Live Data" and give the dashboard a more professional look.
Match the dashboard color theme to the palette used on https://eagletrax.mypetersime.com/.
Update data parsing to support the new Google Apps Script JSON structure, including parsing the non-ISO "Timestamp" format (e.g., "10/02/26 10:42:57").
Plot an additional series "Temperature CSV(F)" as a red dashed line and include it in the chart legend.
Switch to a clean, white design with accent color #65714B applied consistently across the dashboard UI and chart styling.
Increase usage of accent color #65714B across the website/dashboard styling (more prominent application in UI elements).
Change the footer text from "Built with love using caffeine.ai" to "built by Hannes @Petersime".
Apply accent color #65714B in the title bar (titelbalk) styling.
Replace the header/subtitle text "Real-time temperature monitoring system" with "updated every 10 min".
Update the chart legend so it clearly indicates that "Temperature CSV (°F)" is a dashed (stippled) line.
Design a new classy, professional enterprise-grade dashboard layout (card layout) while keeping accent color #65714B and a white/light default appearance.
Add a second full-width CO₂ chart card below the temperature chart, plotting "CO2 Rechts" and "CO2 Links" plus "CO2 CSV(%)" as a dashed line, using dark-green colors.
Change temperature series styling from red to a darker red shade (including the existing solid and dashed temperature series).
Add an optional dark mode (theme toggle), with light mode as the default.
Implement interactive click-drag/scroll zoom on time axis and synchronize the visible time range across all charts when zooming/panning on any one chart.
Load the full available dataset by default, while allowing users to zoom into a specific time window on the charts.
Fix the card/plot title bars so the darker tint fills the entire title/header area uniformly (not partially).
Update header subtitle text from "Enterprise Data Logging System • Updated every 10 min" to "data logging • Updated every 10-20 min".
Update CO₂ parsing/visualization so CO2 Rechts and CO2 Links are multiplied by 0.001 (manual scaling) and CO2 CSV remains in its original unit "CO2 CSV(%)" so all three CO₂ series are shown in (%).

projectName: Plot Temperature Filtered over time from Google Apps Script JSON endpoint
